content.description: Middle of the backside of the boulder start standing with left hand on a side pull, right hand on vertical crimp and the right foot on the obvious good foot hold. Make a move to a juggy ledge and then the top. A Vb stand start can be done from the juggy ledge and a much harder sit start can be added (but the grade wouldn't fit the rest of the problem).
content.location: Middle of the backside of the boulder.

content.description: Sit start with the left hand in the grooved crack, right hand on the wall, and the left foot on the bottom of the arete. Move up to the right using the crack for hand holds. Finish at the middle of the boulder where the feet have a big ledge. Contrived but fun. Good hand holds.
content.location: Back of the boulder on the very end arete meets the slab.

content.description: Aka, Foot to Mouth Disease. Sit start at the bottom of the crack and then walk feet and hands up. Flat landing with delicate moves makes for a great problem. The stand start can probably be done at V0/1.
content.location: The obvious crack running diagonally from right to left on the front side of the boulder facing the trail.

content.description: Walk up the the slab. No handed and extra points for no knees. Good warmup to get you in the right frame of mind for Coxsackie.
Trapezoidal shaped boulder along the Yellow dot trail.
